org.zaproxy.zap.spider

Class SpiderParam

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parosproxy.paros.common.AbstractParam
      • org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderParam

  • public class SpiderParam
extends AbstractParam
    The SpiderParam wraps all the parameters that are given to the spider.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SpiderParam.HandleParametersOption
      This option is used to define how the parameters are used when checking if an URI was already visited.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpiderParam()
      Instantiates a new spider param.

      • isPostForm

        public boolean isPostForm()
        Checks if is the forms should be submitted with the HTTP POST method. This option should not be used if the forms are not processed at all (processForm).
        Returns:
        true, if the forms should be posted.

      • setPostForm

        public void setPostForm(boolean postForm)
        Sets if the forms should be submitted with the HTTP POST method. This option should not be used if the forms are not processed at all (processForm).
        Parameters:
        postForm - the new post form status

      • isProcessForm

      • setSkipURLString

        public void setSkipURLString(String skipURL)
        Sets the skip url string. This string is being parsed into a pattern which is used to check if a url should be skipped while crawling.
        Parameters:
        skipURL - the new skip url string

      • getHandleParameters

        public SpiderParam.HandleParametersOption getHandleParameters()
        Gets how the spider handles parameters when checking URIs visited.
        Returns:
        the handle parameters visited

      • setHandleParameters

        public void setHandleParameters(SpiderParam.HandleParametersOption handleParametersVisited)
        Sets the how the spider handles parameters when checking URIs visited.
        Parameters:
        handleParametersVisited - the new handle parameters visited value

      • setHandleParameters

        public void setHandleParameters(String handleParametersVisited)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the how the spider handles parameters when checking URIs visited. The provided parameter is, in this case, a String which is cast to the proper value. Possible values are: "USE_ALL", "IGNORE_VALUE", "IGNORE_COMPLETELY".
        Parameters:
        handleParametersVisited - the new handle parameters visited value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • isHandleODataParametersVisited

        public boolean isHandleODataParametersVisited()
        Check if the spider should take into account OData-specific parameters (i.e : resource identifiers) in order to identify already visited URL
        Returns:
        true, for handling OData parameters

      • setHandleODataParametersVisited

        public void setHandleODataParametersVisited(boolean handleODataParametersVisited)
        Defines if the spider should handle OData specific parameters (i.e : resource identifiers) To identify already visited URL
        Parameters:
        handleODataParametersVisited - the new value for handleODataParametersVisited
